handist.collections.dist

Class LongRangeDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • handist.collections.dist.UpdatableDistribution<LongRange>
      • handist.collections.dist.LongRangeDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Distribution<Long>, RangedDistribution<LongRange>, Serializable

    public class LongRangeDistribution
extends UpdatableDistribution<LongRange>
implements RangedDistribution<LongRange>, Distribution<Long>
    Class tracking the distribution of a collection whose entries are identified by LongRange. Currently, this is limited to class DistCol but may be extended to other distributed collections in the future.

    This class allows users to inquire about the location of particular entries of a distributed collection through methods rangeLocation(LongRange), location(Long), and location(LongRange). Internally, this information is kept in a Map<LongRange,Place>.

    This class is an UpdatableDistribution, meaning it can be registered into a collection so that it is automatically updated when changes in the distribution occur, i.e. using DistCol.registerDistribution(UpdatableDistribution). It may even be safely registered into multiple distributed collections provided that the collections do not share any LongRange "keys".

    To maintain the integrity of the distribution with respect to the underlying distributed collection(s), this object cannot be modified by the user.

    Author:
    Patrick Finnerty
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LongRangeDistribution

        public LongRangeDistribution()
        Default constructor. Creates a blank distribution which may be registered into a distributed collection to track its distribution.

      • LongRangeDistribution

        public LongRangeDistribution(Map<LongRange,apgas.Place> map)
        Parameters:
        map - map from LongRange to Place describing a distribution

      • LongRangeDistribution

        protected LongRangeDistribution(TreeMap<LongRange,apgas.Place> map)
        Constructor for internal use only. Creates a new LongRangeDistribution with the provided TreeMap. It is assumed that the provided map uses the ChunkedList.LongRangeOrdering to sort its keys. If it is not the case, this constructor will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        map - the map to use to build this instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided map does not use the appropriate ordering
        See Also:
        clone()

      • clone

        public LongRangeDistribution clone()
        Returns a copy of this distribution by allocating a new LongRangeDistribution object. Any subsequent changes made to this object will NOT be reflected into the returned copy and vice-versa.
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object

      • getDistribution

        public Map<LongRange,apgas.Place> getDistribution()
        Creates a copy of the current distribution and returns it as a map from LongRange to Place. The returned map may be modified freely without any adverse influence on the integrity of this instance.
        Returns:
        a copy of the map used internally to keep track of the distribution

      • location

        public apgas.Place location(Long key)
        Description copied from interface: Distribution
        Returns the location of an entry in a distribution
        Specified by:
        location in interface Distribution<Long>
        Parameters:
        key - object used to identify an entry in the distributed collection
        Returns:
        the location of the entry as recorded by this distribution, null if the enquired entry is unknown to this distribution

      • location

        public apgas.Place location(LongRange lr)
        Provides the location of the specified range. It is assumed that the specified range is exactly contained in this distribution. If the targeted range does not exist in the collection, or if it has been split into 2 or more chunks, this method will return null.

        In cases where a range may have been split into several pieces, consider using method rangeLocation(LongRange) to obtain the location of each piece.

        Parameters:
        lr - the range whose location needs to be returned
        Returns:
        the location of the specified range, or null is this exact range is not contained in the distributed collection

      • rangeLocation

        public Map<LongRange,apgas.Place> rangeLocation(LongRange range)
        Description copied from interface: RangedDistribution
        Returns a map of the keys contained in the provided range to the places on which these keys are/should be located.

        Implementation should ensure that there are no duplicated or overlapping keys in the returned map and that all the contents of the range provided as parameter can be reconstructed by the union of the keys in the returned map.

        Specified by:
        rangeLocation in interface RangedDistribution<LongRange>
        Parameters:
        range - the range or collection of "keys" to map to various places
        Returns:
        a Map from R instances to Places
